page.title: 03BOXGROVE SCHOOL - VILLAGE
page.content: The children previously stayed at the school until they were 15 yrs. old whereas now they leave at age 11 yrs. continuing with their education in Chichester. In 1984 the school were winners in the Best Kept Village Competition (Schools Project) run by the Sussex Rural Community Council. { {BOXGROVE}has 138 council houses and 90 private houses within the parish. An interesting point being that there are no council houses on the East side of the main road through the village (The Street). There are two Farms, both of which were dairy farms until only 2 or 3 yrs. ago. Priory Farm is now an arable Farm growing numerous crops. Oil seed Rape, wheat, barley, oats, and peas. The peas grown are for next years seed. Boxgrove Farm also has various crops growing in the fields.
